goal.ch:
你想進入台積電工作嗎?想瞭解地球物理的地震波和光(optics)與電磁(EM)波的力學傳遞機制或肌理嗎?想瞭解地震的破裂力學基礎嗎?這門課沿續大一的普物課程帶你進入這些行道的學理。透過目前火熱的Python/Matlab腳本式電腦語言來強化你對力學的理解與實作經驗。打算修課同學最好是大三或大四學生，且已有寫這兩種語言之一的上課經驗，或已修過線性代數與在其他課中具基礎電腦語言寫作經驗為佳。課程目標:
1. 以Text book為主， reference為輔，講述著重於重要觀念及內容解釋。學生需跟上進度與課後作業習作。
2. 於每一章節結束後，由課文內容選取作業習作題目讓學生練習並繳交作業。
3. 由助教與授課老師負責作業之解答，說明與評量。
4. 每個章節平均以二-三週時間授課完畢。學期總目標為上完第七章。
goal.en:
Would you like to be employed by TSMC? Would you like to engaged in geophysics and seismology studies involving “seismic/earthquake“, “Optics“ and “EM“ waves propagation principles? The class is designed to continue your high school physics and “general physics“ classes you ever learned before but try to enhance your understand through hands on python/matlab scripting language homework exercises. Goals:
1. Mainly following text book contents and occasionally use resources from other references
2. Emphasis on the concepts development, explanation and logical steps and organization
3. Student needs to follow the progress of the lecture with assign homework exercises for each chapter
4. TA and teacher will help homework grading and assistant student on problem solving
5. Each chapter will takes about 2 to 3 weeks to accomplish the homework assignment and lecture 
6. Tentatively I will try to finish chapter 7 without touching chapter 5

outline.ch:
課程內容:
(1)沿續高中與大一普物的古典牛頓動力學原理:質點與多質點運動。如何做微分與積分。
(2)如何將力，位移，速度，加速度間的相關性進一步地來了解動能，位能與總能的估算。
(3)由高中所學的簡諧振盪(SHM)進一步讓學生了解具外力作用下或內部摩擦產生的振盪特性。
(4)慣性與非慣性座標系統下的過度(over-)，處於(under-)，產生臨界(critical-)阻尼或稱衰減機制。
(5)由線性進入稍為複雜的非線性系統，學習如何分析與用哪種邏輯思緒與來解決問題。
(6)量測時序資料的振福與相位資訊，光與電磁波的費瑪(Fermat)原理。
(7)由費瑪原理進一步談Hermitian與Lagrange方程在地科科研議題上的相關性與應用。
outline.en:
Class contents:
(1)Continue your ‘high school physics‘ and freshman ‘general physics“ classes you learned before.
(2)Learn how to do differentiation and integration. How to link and quantify “force“, “displacement/velocity/acceleration“ and further more how to estimate total energy, kinetic and potential energy.
(3)Newtonian mechanics: single and many particle motions and oscillations.
(4)Understand SHM, Damped and Forced Oscillations. Cover over-, under- and critical- damped system.
(5)Motions in a inertial and non-inertial reference frames.
(6)Introduce nonlinear complex system (fractal) and subjects related to Earth Sciences studies.
(7)How to measure amplitude/phase and attributes involved in the time-dependent data.
(8)From Fermat‘s principle, calculus of variations to Hermitian and Lagrange equations

textbook.ch:
1.教科書: Classical Dynamics of particle and system, by Thornton ＆ Marion, 5th ed., Text book.
2.參考書: Analytical Mechanics, by Fowles G.R. ＆ Cassiday, G.I., 7th ed., Reference Text book.
3.上課講義與課外閱讀Hand outs (additional) and reading material.   
4.上課的PPT擋案以幫助學生理解課本內容 (Assist student on text book readings and homework exercises).
5.以課本內容為主。自編教材目的為輔佐學生瞭解力學的各種應用.
textbook.en:
1.Text Book: Classical Dynamics of particle and system, by Thornton ＆ Marion, 5th ed., Text book.
2. Reference book: Analytical Mechanics, by Fowles G.R. ＆ Cassiday, G.I., 7th ed., Reference Text book.
3. Hand outs (additional) and reading material.
4. Power point files to assist student on text book readings and homework exercises.
5. Lectures is mainly based on text book contents. Additional material served as helping students to understand its associated applications.

gradMethod.ch:
評量方式:
1. 以平時作業練習為主。其中與期末考方式進行學習評量為輔，理想上每章可分兩次平時作業或小考。
2. 評量主要會以兼顧觀念與數學式的物性理解這兩部分為主。實做練習為主推導較少。
3. 實做練習，考試內容均以書本範例與習題為主。
4. 若修課同學平常作業或小考表現優良，可考慮免除期末考試。若學習效果不佳則無法免除考慮考期末考。
5. 鼓勵自主學習。若學生想或強化這門課的認知，可包含學生的學期計畫。期末考以口頭或書面報告為主。
gradMethod.en:
1. Mainly based on homework assignments. Two homework exercises or tests on each chapter.
2. Content of the homework/test are mostly from text book with some alternations of the text book examples.
3. The grading will emphasis on the concepts and mathematical understandings by computer exercises.
4. Final examination will be held depends on students learning status. If good then can be waived, if not then final exam. will be enforced.
5. To promote aggressive self-learning, semester project can be offered to students who would like to promote themselves for better learning. Semester project can be treated as final. Semester project can be presented through oral presentation, report or tests.
